newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisia to produce up to 90,000T tomato puree in 97.
newsitem.headline: Tunisia to produce up to 90,000T tomato puree in 97.

text.p: Tunisia expects tomato puree output to reach 90,000 tonnes in 1997, slightly down from the exceptional production last year, Le Temps newspaper reported on Friday.
The country's tomato puree (concentre de tomates) output rose to 105,000 tonnes in 1996, the newspaper said.
"Many factors were behind the performance of tomato production in recent years, including the introduction of modern irrigation techniques," it said.
An estimated 21,000 hectares (52,500 acres) were cultivated with tomatoes or 14 percent of market gardening in 1997, it said. Tomato cultivated surface represented 22,000 hectares in 1996.
An average 75 percent of tomato output is devoted to the country's agro-industry and which represents 86 percent of canned vegetable activity, it added.
Officials were not immediately available for comment.
